bibl.title: Military Orders for Rafael T. Echeverria and Roger Post Ames, January 20, 1900

div1.p: In Special Orders #11, Echeverria and Ames are appointed to a board of officers to qualify men for the position of hospital steward. Included is a note written by [Hench]. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Rafael Echeverria and Roger Post Ames, January 20, 1900
div1.p:
Orders relating to
more than one person -
arranged in calendar
sequence

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, January 20, 1900.

1. Acting Assistant Surgeon T. C. Lyster, U. S. Army,
is hereby relieved from further duty at these headquarters
and will report to the Commanding General, Department
of Havana, for assignment.

2. Under authority of paragraph 1, General Orders No.
31, series of 1899, Headquarters of the Army, the Subsist-
ence Department will commute the rations of Private Robert
J. Boylan, troop I, 8th U. S. Cavalry, now on special duty
as clerk at Headquarters, District of Puerto Príncipe, Puer-
to Príncipe, Cuba, from and including January 15, 1900,
and while engaged in the performance of this duty, at the
rate of one dollar and fifty cents ($1.50) per day, it having
been and being impracticable to provide for his subsistence
in any other way.

3. Second Class Private John D. Latimore, Signal Corps,
U. S. Army, having reported to the signal officer, Depart-
ment of Santiago and Puerto Príncipe, for duty in pursuance
of paragraph 23, Special Orders No. 300, series of 1899,
Headquarters of the Army, the Quartermaster's Depart-
ment will furnish him suitable quarters at a rental not
exceeding twelve ($12.00) dollars per month, and the
Subsistence Department will, under authority of paragraph
1, General Orders No. 31, series of 1899, Headquarters of
the Army, commute the rations of this soldier, from and
including January 10, 1900, and while engaged in the per-
formance of his present duty, at the rate of one dollar and
fifty cents ($1.50) per day, it having been and being im-
practicable to provide for his subsistence in any other way.
4. A board of officers, to consist of:
R. P. Ames, Acting Assistant Surgeon, U. S. Army;

is hereby appointed to meet at U. S. Military Hospital No.
1, Havana, Cuba, at 10 o'clock, a. m., Wednesday, January
24, 1900, or as soon thereafter as practicable, for the purpose
of examining Private James L. Burt, Hospital Corps, U. S.
Army, as to his qualifications and fitness for detail as acting
hospital steward.

The board will be governed by the regulations prescribed
by, and render its report to, the Chief Surgeon of the
Division.

5. By reason of the limited means of transportation be-
tween Havana and Santiago de Cuba, and the necessity for
immediate compliance with orders, the journey performed
by Major Russell B. Harrison, Inspector General, Depart-
ment of Santiago and Puerto Principe, June 30, 1899, by
steamer “Mortera” via the north coast of Cuba to Santiago,
is confirmed as having been necessary for the public
service.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:
